html:
Alternative forms[edit]

  • reconligō

Etymology[edit]

re- +‎ colligō.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /reˈkol.li.ɡoː/, [rɛˈkɔl.lʲɪ.ɡoː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /reˈkol.li.ɡo/, [rɛˈkɔl.li.ɡɔ]

Verb[edit]

recolligō (present infinitive recolligere, perfect active recollēgī, supine recollēctum); third conjugation

  1. I recover, gather again, collect.
  2. (reflexive) pull oneself together

Conjugation[edit]

  • Note: Perfect terms are sometimes of the form recollex.. rather than recolleg...

Derived terms[edit]

  • recollēctus

Descendants[edit]

  • Catalan: recollir
  • Dalmatian: recolgro
  • English: recollect
  • French: recueillir
  • Friulian: racuei
  • Galician: recoller
  • Italian: raccogliere
  • Occitan: reculhir
  • Portuguese: recolher
  • Romanian: reculege
  • Sardinian: recogliere, regollere
  • Spanish: recoger, recolegir

  • recolligo in Gaffiot, Félix (1934) Dictionnaire Illustré Latin-Français, Hachette
